definition: deliberate violation (idiom); intentional crime
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to know/to be aware
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: The persistence of the highest level, knowingly passed the way.
sentences.chinese: 執着的最高境界，莫過於明知故犯了。

sentences.english: We knowingly altered a Probable Historical Site.
sentences.chinese: 我們明知故犯地毀壞了一處可能的歷史遺蹟。

sentences.english: Knowingly marching down that road would be insane.
sentences.chinese: 明知故犯地走上那條道路是極其愚蠢的行爲。

to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to challenge the law (idiom)/to knowingly violate the law

to violate/to infringe

excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
error/fault/(law) negligence/delinquency
to evade responsibility/to shirk
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child

to violate/to offend
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
